definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
sheet/piece of writing/bound set of bamboo slips used for record keeping (old)/classifier for written items: chapter, article

sentences.english: The literature of the 19th century is rich with great travel writing.
sentences.chinese: 19世纪的文学是游记名篇的渊薮。

sentences.english: He likened the story to Tolstoy's moral tales.
sentences.chinese: 他把这个故事比做托尔斯泰的道德名篇。

sentences.english: Praise of White Poplar is a famous essay of Mao Dun .
sentences.chinese: 《白杨礼赞》是茅盾先生的散文名篇。

sentences.english: Rhapsody On Wucheng is a highly praised famous piece among Bao Zhao's works handed down to posterity.
sentences.chinese: 《芜城赋》是鲍照传世作品中受人称颂的赋作名篇。

sentences.english: Bai Juyi, a famous poet. Yijiangnan is his famous poem.
sentences.chinese: 白居易，一位著名的诗人，《忆江南》是他的名篇。

sentences.english: Masterpiece appreciation is very important to the teaching of Ancient Literature.
sentences.chinese: 名篇赏析对于古代文学教学意义重大。

sentences.english: Using appropriate quotations from classics will add lustre to your essay.
sentences.chinese: 恰当地称引名篇会使你的文章增色不少。

sentences.english: Zhu Ziqing's The Sight of Father's Back is one of the most famous essays in China.
sentences.chinese: 朱自清的代表作《背影》堪称散文界的抒情名篇。
